title: About
text:
Hello! I’m Zixuan Liu, better known as Lydia. I’m currently navigating my final year at UCLA, where I’m pursuing majors in both Statistics & Data Science and Mathematics/Economics.


Professionally, I’ve honed my analytical prowess through rigorous internships across the globe—from decoding complex datasets. My approach combines robust quantitative skills with a nuanced understanding of data storytelling, particularly aimed at refining operational strategies and influencing pivotal decisions in diverse sectors.


Beyond the confines of data and numbers, I explore a variety of passions ranging from the precision of archery to the creative folds of origami. Each hobby offers a unique outlet for the skills I cultivate in my academic and professional life, reinforcing my belief in a well-rounded lifestyle.


Dive into my projects and experiences to discover how I merge analytical rigor with creative insight, driving impactful outcomes in everything from entertainment analytics to global market trends.


Email: zix7iu@g.ucla.edu LinkedIn: Visit my LinkedIn

View My Resume

title: Projects
text:
·Defined classes for regret algorithms in Python and implemented reinforcement learning bandit models in chemistry reaction applications to optimize experimental proposals and identify optimal conditions for chemical reactions.


·Conducted simulation to introduce experiment noises to the current dataset with NumPy in Python, and validated the performance of optimal bandit algorithms with various random noise level.


·Website: Visit GitHub

title: Projects
text:
Opioid Use Disorder Treatment Stages

·Developed SQL dashboards to monitor daily KPIs of over 400 sales personnel across 16 provinces, identifying key performance insights.


·Utilized XGBoost machine learning models in Python to forecast regional sales, enhancing predictive accuracy by adapting model hyperparameters.


·Designed performance metrics and incentive schemes that increased overall team KPIs by 25% through strategic data analyses and goal-setting.

title: Projects
section: Tobacco Smoke Impact on Respiratory Diseases
text:
Tobacco Smoke Impact on Respiratory Diseases

·Acquired and aggregated smoke exposure and respiratory health data from National Health and Nutrition Examination dataset, excluded rows and imputed missing values with Deep Neural Network and Datawig library in Python.


·Built interactive dashboards with Plotly in Python and Microsoft Power BI, allowing users to visually explore the impact of tobacco smoke on respiratory diseases.


·Website: Visit GitHub

title: Projects
section: Joint Commitment in Human Cooperation Task
text:
Joint Commitment in Human Cooperation Task

·Developed a real-time interactive web application for multiplayer game in Angular with Python, TypeScript, JavaScript, and HTML, and modified the application to adapt to varying numbers of users and various trials.


·Deployed the web application on a public server and assisted in collecting movement trajectory data from users.

title: Projects
text:
Quantitative Cognition in Graphical Representations

·Pre-processed data from Medicare database using SAS DATA Step, compared time spent in each treatment stages with ANOVA, and created grouped bar charts for annual patient distribution from 2018 to 2023 across stages.


·Evaluated the impact of treatment initiation timing on relapse rates using a Marginal Structural Cox Model, demonstrated a 6% reduction in relapse following the removal of prior authorization requirements.
